meanings.definition: Used for emphasis or to express annoyance or surprise.
meanings.sent1: Freaking! I can't believe I forgot my lunch.
meanings.sent2: Stop freaking out; everything will be okay.
meanings.sent3: Freaking! I dropped my phone in the toilet.
meanings.sent4: Her scream was like a freaking thunderclap in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The sudden lightning strike was freaking loud and blinding.

meanings.sent1: She was freaking tired after running the marathon.
meanings.sent2: I am freaking excited to see the new movie.
meanings.sent3: The cat was freaking fast, zooming around the house.
meanings.sent4: The mountain was freaking tall, reaching up to touch the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The cake was freaking delicious, with layers of rich chocolate.
